text:
Palmer is a city in Washington County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 111 people lived there.
History.
Palmer was founded in 1878. It was named for J. Palmer, a teacher.
The first post office in Palmer was founded in June 1878.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
Climate.
Palmer has warm to hot (and often humid) summers and cold (sometimes severely cold) winters. According to the Köppen Climate Classification says that Palmer has a humid continental climate, abbreviated "Dfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 111 people, 50 households, and 34 families living in the city.
